radiographic_examinations.findings: The imaged lung bases are clear without focal opacity, pleural or pericardial effusion. The appendix is dilated and fluid-filled with hyperemic wall and periappendiceal stranding. Dilated to 11 mm. Marked inflammatory reaction in the base of the cecum. The remainder of the large bowel is unremarkable. There is no free air or focal fluid collection. No mesenteric or retroperitoneal pathologic adenopathy, though reactive nodes are seen. The bladder is distended and unremarkable. No lytic or sclerotic bony lesion concerning for osseous malignant process.
